Website Pricing Calculator

This tool is designed to help you estimate how much a website is going to cost

Download This Tool

How Many Pages?

The amount of custom pages a website is going to need can help you easily determine how much a it's going to cost you to build it. When I say pages here I'm referring to webpages like a home page, an about page, etc.

1 - 6 - pages is for small website like those for local shops that need a foundation for their business online.

7 - 19 pages is for medium sized. This is for people who are a little bit more serious about their online marketing strategy. More complex designed website with a decent amount of functionality

+20 pages is for larger websites that require a lot design work and have provide multiple function like ecomerce stores, custom profiles

CMS (Content Management System)

A CMS can help you easily maintain larger websites. Is your new website going to need a dedicated content management system?

No - You won't be requiring a CMS, you'll be using basic web technologies like HTML, CSS, & JavaScript.

Yes - You will be using a content management system like Wordpress or Drupal

Responsive Design

Basic Responsiveness here refers to the extent to which you want the design on your website to adapt. Responsive design is tedious work and making sure your web application looks pixel perfect across as many devices as possible is up to you.

Level of Design

simple - If you're not looking for anything too grand you just want some pages too work or you just need to have something up this is your options

Custom - CUstom refers to just that. YOu get a higher level of design that bring attention to detail to your business and can potential increase your website visiiblity

What is this?

This is a website pricing calculator I made. My goal with this tool was to help people who are interested in starting a website get an idea of how much their project might cost. I made this tool using only HTML CSS & JavaScript. I also designed the icons for this tool. It took me a few days to make all the graphics and put together the code to make this tool function the exact way I wanted it too.

How To Use This Web Pricing Tool

Select a button for each grouping of questions. If questions is not unclear refer to the guide or the guide above or skip the question.

When a button is selected a thick dark border will surround it indicating your selection.

After selection n picked an option for each question scroll down towards the bottom of the page and click the "Get Estimate" to see the final price.

Future Plans - Send Feed Back

The calculator is a simple 4 question answer though if this gets a lot of downloads and I get some donations I will be adding significantly more features and customization.

Use This Tool On Your Website

If you want to download and edit this tool on your website go ahead just make sure to give some credit if you can.
